name: Hotel Arc La Rambla

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned yesterday from our European vacation and Arc la Rambla was the last hotel we stayed in. I was very nervous about staying there after reading previous reviews and debated what I would take as a result of the thefts. But I was pleased to find a very modern lobby and helpful staff. Our room was pleasantly large and had a safe which we used for free. The room was very clean and the location could not be beat. I would definitely stay there again. We even felt that it was the best hotel we had stayed in during our whole trip. I only suggest that you take what you need and avoid taking too many valuables that may not fit in the small safe.
reviews.title: Great location at a great price!

reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights - great location. The hotel had some very recent remodeling going on, as many halllways were just painted. The only negative, was the room desperately lacked anywhere to put anything. No tables or dressers. Even the bathroom (large) had no place to put anything.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - Great location

reviews.title: Good Hotel, location excellent
Very nice, well located on Rambla
reviews.text: Much better than expected from reading earlier reviews. They couldn't make good on the wifi though, which I had counted on.

reviews.title: Good Budget
reviews.text: Ok reading the reviews I had no idea what to expect but come on folks this is not a bad hotel. The entrance, smart polished marble, the reception staff I met were very helpful. The lifts worked and the room (the basic double) was clean and tidy although I have to say the bright avacado coloured bathroom suite took a bit of getting used to. It's plus and minus is it's central location. Near the bottom of the Ramblas and at the front as I was there was some noise. However double glazed double doors inside the shutters kept that down to a minimum. At the far end of reception, away from the entrance, a set of luggage lockers are provided which will fit a large suitcase for 2 euros. I think this is better than dumping the bags in a room which nobody supervises.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No "Welcome" no "goodbye. No escape/ safety- plan. No information. Extremely noisy. You, as a guest of hotel,must pay extra for storage of suitcase the day of leaving.
reviews.title: Very disappointed

reviews.text: a group of us stayed here for 3 nights when we arrived and got booked into our rooms 2 of therooms at the front of the hotel on the 3rd floor were dirty and smelly we complained and they said that there was no more available until the next day so the next morning we were moved to just ok of rooms they were not the rooms that we seen on the internet and the staff were not the friendliest of people would not stay there again
reviews.title: not a nice place
Arc La Rambla, would not recommed this hotel
reviews.text: August 2007 Stayed at this Hotel for 2 nights, the only good thing i have to say about it was that it was clean and there was a safe. The room was small, there was no shower curtain, when having a shower you had to wash yourself and hold the shower in your other hand, the guy at reception was not helpful at all, very rude. When entering the hotel there was a terrible smell and it followed through as you went up the stairs to your room. We had a balcony which was great as the air con was crap, did not work properly. The other group that was with us had rooms with no windows i.e. no air and the air con wasn't much better in their rooms. We got the older rooms in the Hotel, although they seem to be re decorating parts of the hotel. It is ther perfect location for La Rambla and the shopping etc but im sure there are nicer hotels on the strip.

reviews.title: Okay but once was enough
reviews.text: We weren't robbed and our room was spotlessly clean although very small. There was no safe. The room included a sliding glass door which we could not lock but which wouldn't open more than 2 inches either. The staff were professional. friendly, and helpful. The ground floor has recently been modernized and looks lovely but smells like cat pee. The location is wonderful! We paid 75 euros per night and were given a continental breakfast on our first morning for free. The second morning we left at 6am, too early for such an amenity.

reviews.title: Worst Hotel Ever......
reviews.text: I Checked into Hotel thinking that it was really nice considering it was only 2 stars....well was i mistaken.....I Left the room for about 1 hour only to return and find my knapsack was gone....my knapsack carried a laptop, clothing, expensive makeup and sunglassed, cell phone chargers, memory cards for my camera....I felt very violated...This hotel has a policy to leave your ghetto old fashioned key at the front desk when ever your leave your hotel room....well the staff then takes your key and robs your room...this experience totally ruined my vacation and I would never ever go back to Barcelona or this hotel again......I already heard about all the purse snatchings but i never in a million years would think that someone would actually go in my room and rob me and to make matters worse it was an employee of the hotel...They were no help at all and they sat there and smirked the whole time I was crying and upset and trying to get to the bottom of what happened. They called the police and told me the police would not come...then i called the police on my own and they said the hotel staff told them not to come to me..but they made it there about 5 minutes after my phone call...(the police station is a block away from hotel)..If you want to keep your belongings and your rights do not stay at this hotel trust me....You will make a mistake of your life to trust these arogant people...The employees of the hotel were very rude...no help at all when it came to anything...PLUS they have a on site security guard that basically walked away when he heard my bag was gone...and was never seen again that day....what is the point of having security....They twisted the story to the police man....Then i asked them to check the cameras to see who walked out with my bag and the employees of the hotel said they need a permit to check the cameras and the only one who has the permit is the Owner...which the Owner does not live in Barcelona....How convienient is that??

reviews.title: Do not stay here!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.text: I know that the problem of HOTEL THEFT was mentioned in a previous email, but I am going to go into a bit more detail. My family and I checked into the hotel in March for a few nights. We were told upon checking in that we should leave our key at the front desk whenever we left the hotel. They said this measure was to prevent us from losing it while out, but I soon realized it was their way of determining whether or not you were in your room. As soon as we checked in, we headed out for a quick lunch. An hour later, we returned to find our $2000 brand new laptop had been stolen right out

reviews.title: OK but book a premier room..
reviews.text: of our locked room! The laptop bag also contained many other valuable

reviews.title: Unimpressive
reviews.text: items, none of which would fit in the safe. We made the wrong assumption that it was safe to leave items in our hotel room. We immediately informed the staff. A young guy who worked at the front desk had a knowing smirk on his face the entire time, which lead us to believe that he was involved. When we checked in we walked up to our room and there was NO ONE anywhere around....so who else could have known we had a laptop in that particular room besides the hotel staff? The manager was being completely unhelpful and simply shrugged
Considering that they are trying to achieve an upgrade to a 3 star, I found the staff a little unfriendly at times..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing that really upset us was when we left, the hotel booked a taxi for us to the airport and we ended up paying €39 which was double that what we payed on the way to the hotel..all the other taxis we used also were very cheap when called from the street and quite accessable.. so we really didn't need to book..
